intro: Casearia serrata, commonly known as the serrated casearia, is a tropical shrub belonging to the Salicaceae family. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges, and it produces small, yellowish-green flowers that develop into spherical, woody fruits. Casearia serrata is often found in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
